job_description:
1. Inventory Control & Monitoring
Record, track, and update stock levels of raw materials, packaging, and finished goods in the inventory system.
Conduct routine stock counts and physical verifications to ensure data accuracy.
Identify and report any stock discrepancies, damages, or losses to the supervisor immediately.
Monitor material movement (incoming, outgoing, returns, and transfers) accurately and in real time.

2. Warehouse Management Support
Ensure proper labeling, organization, and storage of all items according to product type and condition.
Assist in maintaining cleanliness, order, and safety within the warehouse area.
Coordinate with the warehouse and production teams to ensure smooth material flow.
Support inventory audits and reconciliation processes.

3. Documentation & Reporting
Maintain accurate documentation of stock movements, purchase receipts, and item usage.
Prepare and submit periodic inventory reports to management.
Record and archive stock adjustment forms, inventory reports, and audit results for traceability.
Ensure all documentation complies with company policies and audit requirements.

4. Coordination & Communication
Communicate stock status and potential shortages to procurement and production departments.
Support purchasing by providing accurate and timely stock information.
Collaborate with related departments to optimize stock levels and minimize waste.

5. System & Process Improvement
Ensure all transactions are entered correctly in the ERP or inventory management system.
Identify process gaps and suggest improvements to increase inventory accuracy and efficiency.
Participate in developing and implementing standard operating procedures (SOP) for inventory management.
